docs.abstract: Don’t ignore a feeling that you have more than you need. Talk about money — with family and others.
docs.snippet: Don’t ignore a feeling that you have more than you need. Talk about money — with family and others.
docs.lead_paragraph: “First you need to figure out: What do I actually have? How much can I access?” says Willa Conway, who is 31, currently has $3 million at her disposal and will eventually inherit millions more from a sand-mining fortune. Don’t ignore a feeling that you have more than you need. When Conway was in her mid-20s, a graduate-school adviser told her about Resource Generation, which helps the young and wealthy redistribute their wealth. At a four-day retreat Conway attended, a presenter said, “Give your money to social-justice organizing led by people most impacted by oppression.” After Michael Brown Jr. was shot by the police in Ferguson, Mo., Conway helped lead a campaign that raised $1.4 million for more than 100 organizing groups led by African-Americans.

headline.main: How to Give Away Your Trust Fund
headline.print_headline: How to Give Away Your Trust Fund

docs.abstract: We think we know what we like — but do we understand why?
docs.snippet: We think we know what we like — but do we understand why?
docs.lead_paragraph: When I was a wine merchant, there was no more common line to encounter from patrons than a nervous, “I don’t really know anything about wine, but I know what I like.” In other words: Show me the pinot noir, and leave me alone.

headline.main: Letter of Recommendation: Terry Theise Wine Catalogs

docs.abstract: The film is a rare portrayal of black people in our fullness — angry and frightened and hurt, euphoric and loving and free.
docs.snippet: The film is a rare portrayal of black people in our fullness — angry and frightened and hurt, euphoric and loving and free.
docs.lead_paragraph: The person I love and I were among the first members of the public to see the new film “Queen & Slim.” Early in September, we watched it alone on an upper floor of a nondescript office building in downtown San Francisco. It was a phenomenally isolating experience. We sat in a screening room accompanied by two affable white P.R. people and a black security guard who said nothing. The room was otherwise empty. It was 11 a.m.

headline.main: ‘Queen & Slim’ Could Be One of the Great Love Stories of All Time — if You Let It

docs.abstract: On Instagram, “mom” means linen-clad babies and perfect homes. On TikTok, it’s real women being their wholesome, goofy selves.
docs.snippet: On Instagram, “mom” means linen-clad babies and perfect homes. On TikTok, it’s real women being their wholesome, goofy selves.
docs.lead_paragraph: A rural or rural-seeming scene: In the foreground, in the lower left-hand corner of the frame, a cherubic middle-aged woman with short blond hair and a friendly, expressive face holds up an index finger. Behind her, a man with a paunch and a handlebar mustache emerges from a black truck just as she starts to lip-sync the 1997 song “My Baby Daddy,” by B-Rock and the Bizz. You’d guess he’s her husband, and he’s obviously a good sport. As he saunters toward the front of the truck, the woman tickles the air in his general direction. He leans on a headlight and smiles. They are corny, playful, in that goofy parental way that makes kids groan in embarrassment.

headline.main: The Moms of TikTok Are Deeply Corny — and Gloriously Free

docs.abstract: Democrats believe the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee could be the man to bring down President Trump. This is how he’s running his investigation.
docs.snippet: Democrats believe the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee could be the man to bring down President Trump. This is how he’s running his investigation.
docs.lead_paragraph: ‘This president, he’s like a planetary object,” Adam Schiff said. “He warps time. And things that you think happened a couple weeks ago, it turns out, only happened a day or two ago.”

headline.main: Inside Adam Schiff’s Impeachment Game Plan
